div.head: Hamlet, First quarto, 1603
div.p:
Enter Hamlet.
Cor. Madame, will it pleaſe your grace
To leaue vs here?
Que. With all my hart. exit.
Cor. And here Ofelia, reade you on this booke,
And walke aloofe, the King ſhal be vnſeene.
Ham. To be, or not to be, I here’s the point,
To Die, to ſleepe, is that all? I all:
No, to ſleepe, to dreame, I mary there it goes,
For in that dreame of death, when wee awake,
And borne before an euerlaſting Iudge,
From whence no paſſenger euer retur’nd,
The vndiſcouered country, at whoſe ſight
The happy ſmile, and the accurſed damn’d.
But for this, the ioyfull hope of this,
Whol’d beare the ſcornes and flattery of the world,
Scorned by the right rich, the rich curſſed of the poore?
